tagging.credit: This grammatical parser supports Sanskrit input and was made possible with data from the <link>Digital Corpus of Sanskrit</link> by Oliver Hellwig.

translation.usageNoticeShort: Dharmamitra's machine translation can make mistakes. Please use responsibly.

usageNoticeLong.p1: Dharmamitra leverages cutting-edge deep neural networks to efficiently provide machine translations. We are working hard to provide the best possible quality. While our technology continues to advance and our services are frequently updated, please keep in mind:
usageNoticeLong.p2: Dharmamitra is designed to complement human expertise, not replace it. By combining our advanced technology with your discernment, you can make the most of our translation services.

ul.1: Dharmamitra is a tool to help understand classical Asian texts preserved in different languages
ul.2: When in doubt, we recommend consulting with language experts, or referring to established human translations.
ul.3: We encourage users to review and verify Dharmamitra's output before sharing it.

placeholders.default: Enter text to translate in Sanskrit, Tibetan, Buddhist scriptural Chinese or English.
placeholders.englishExplained: Enter Sanskrit text to translate and explaine, using one line per sentence. (Currently, explanation is only available for Sanskrit)

metadata.title: Dharmamitra · a toolkit for the languages of the Dharma
metadata.description: A toolkit for the languages of the Dharma

Home.title: 歡迎來到法之善友AI計畫

about.p1: MITRA’s Mission is to harness the rapidly evolving AI technologies to promote the scholarly study and personal practice of the dharma and to accelerate academic and individual research through open-source collaboration on datasets, models and applications.

auto-translation.title: Automated Translation
auto-translation.description: Sanskrit, classical Tibetan, and classical Chinese to modern languages including Chinese, Tibetan, Korean, and Japanese

semantic-search.title: Semantic Search
semantic-search.description: Refining semantic search across a growing body of Sanskrit, Classical Tibetan, and Classical Chinese texts

toolkit.title: Philologist's Toolkit
toolkit.description: Develop tools to facilitate the study of Sanskrit and Classical Tibetan

about.p2: In the future we hope to provide Generative AI tools that enable elevating and transformative experiences through:

roadmap.art: Generation of 2D art based on canonical guildelines

project.p1: MITRA is a research project in the Berkeley AI Research lab in EECS at the University of California, Berkeley. It is spearheaded by Kurt Keutzer and Sebastian Nehrdich, focuses on bridging the linguistic divide between ancient wisdom source languages and contemporary languages through the application of advanced Deep Learning and AI technologies.
project.p2: Initiated in 2023, the project quickly evolved from its conceptual phase to a dynamic development process, accelerated  by its collaborative efforts with organizations such as monlam.ai and with contributions from a diverse array of sources, including translators and AI researchers. Leveraging a robust corpus of over four million sentence pairs from various sourcesand utilizing Google's MADLAD-400 model as a foundation, MITRA has fine-tuned a specialized translation model that not only promises enhanced fluency in translations but also aims to significantly expand access to ancient wisdom texts.
project.p3: Through continuous improvements in data quality, sentence alignment, and model fine-tuning, the project seeks to overcome the challenges inherent in low-resource language translation. The MITRA project stands as a testament to the transformative potential of AI in transcending language barriers, embodying a commitment to cultural preservation, academic research, and the democratization of access to Tibetan literature and wisdom.

monlam.name: <link>monlam.ai</link>
monlam.description: Machine translation data collection for Tibetan and English

kumarajiva.name: <link>Kumarajiva project</link>
kumarajiva.description: Development of Tibetan<>Chinese capabilities and user interface for specific translation purposes

iitk.name: <link>IIT Kharagpur</link>
iitk.description: Development of Sanskrit translation model development. Sanskrit<>English dataset compilation

tsadra.name: <link>Tsadra Foundation</link>
tsadra.description: Providing vital funding for the combined study and practice of Tibetan Buddhism in the West

development.p1: We’re continuously developing our custom APIs to iteratively improve the quality of Dharmamitra’s translation and other capabilities, as well as offer new features. To learn more about the theoretical background behind Mitra’s development, check our <locallink>news feed</locallink> where we periodically share updates that include information about the project’s underpinning ideas.
development.p2: Dharmamitra uses Gemini API services to provide the best possible results to users, and its Sanskrit grammatical parser relies on data from the <link>Digital Corpus of Sanskrit</link>.

card1.title: We'd love to hear from you!
card1.text: If you have any comments or suggestions, please take a moment to share your thoughts with us. We really appreciate every message we get helping to make Dharmamitra better for everyone.

card2.title: Building on Mitra
card2.text: If you are interested in using the Dharmamitra, or its API to build your own project, please contact us beforehand to discuss this with us.

intro.p1: Dharmamitra has been developed to support Kumarajiva translators in their work translating Dharma texts.

features.p1: Dharmamitra provides both a search engine and a translation service specifically targetting Dharma texts, including traditional source material and modern research literature.
